<<<<<<< HEAD
A pleasaunt conceited historie, called The taming of a shrew As it hath beene sundry times acted by the right Honourable the Earle of Pembrooke his Seruants. Taming of a shrew.
[52] p.
By V[alentine] S[immes] for Nicholas Ling, and are to be sold at his shop in Saint Dunstons Church-yard in Fleetstreet, Printed at London : 1607.
In verse. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-F⁴ G² . The connection with Shakespeare's play is obscure. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery. the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
